doc.previous: Matrices are commonly written in box brackets
doc.after: An alternative notation uses large parentheses instead of box brackets  The specifics of symbolic matrix notation varies widely with some prevailing trends Matrices are usually symbolized using upper case letters such as A in the examples above while the corresponding lower case letters with two subscript indices e g a11 or a1 1 represent the entries In addition to using upper case letters to symbolize matrices many authors use a special typographical style commonly boldface upright non italic to further distinguish matrices from other mathematical objects An alternative notation involves the use of a double underline with the variable name with or without boldface style e g
